body: @SudharmaJain can you rebase and push to see if we can get this green for the 4.9 freeze...
@sudhansu7 can you rebase and push to see if we can get this green before the freeze?  Thx...
@sanju1010 we have merge conflicts now. Can you please rebase against the current master. Code freeze is basically now, so if you want this in we need to get busy...
@syed can you rebase and force push this one?  Thanks...
@DaanHoogland can you rebase and push this one again to see if we can get travis to finally pass?  thx...

This one is pretty much ready, but without verification that it works and without the required code reviews I can't really justify merging it.  I just don't know if works and does not break anything...  Not sure what to do with this one...  4.9 freeze is VERY close right now, so time is of the essence...
This one is ready to merge.  I would love another code review on this one as it is green and the CI is clean...
@swill I just reopened. was there any reason to rebase?

there were a couple fixes to jenkins and travis in a commit a few days ago, so i wanted to make sure those fixes were in the code base when you pushed.  I am concerned some of the PRs with failing Jenkins or Travis runs are missing some of the recent fixes.  I am going to have to make judgement calls on some of these anyway.  Just trying to get a final status on everything before I merge and freeze.

I think I am going to have to revert this PR because it seems to be responsible for the `addHost` issue I am having in all my CI environments while doing DeployDC.  On completely new deployments, I got the `addHost` error on all 6 of my CI environments with #1493 included.  I have noticed this as an intermittent issue for the last while, but could not isolate it.

I have reverted #1493 (and it's descendants) locally and I have not had the error in my first 3 tests after reverting it.  I only started seeing the problem after #1493. 

With the freeze basically here, I need my CI environments in action cause I have a few PRs that I really want to run before I merge and freeze...

This is what I plan to run to revert (brackets are for reference, not to be run):

```
git revert 540d9572fd491db3ce182d26636fc74ada4e171c       (1543)
git revert f88cb880974fa56866492c437af291e40bd1a4f6 -m 1  (1538)
git revert 9f970f28b18534dffe33196ead60ea861f501fa9 -m 1  (1534)
git revert 7ce0e10fbcd949375e43535aae168421ecdaa562 -m 1  (1493)
```

I've done some basic testing of this patch adding and deleting ACLs and rules within ACLs within VPCs.
LGTM
LGTM above from @DaanHoogland as well.

@rhtyd I reverted this in master to hopefully unblock my CI environments from failing as I am basically at my freeze date.  Would you mind putting the above commits together in a single PR and reopen it?  We know what we are looking for when we test it on its own again.
Thank you.  I think that bumps this into my judgement call category.  👍
Based on code review and the documentation cited by @remibergsma, the code LGTM.
@swill it's all green now
@swill alright, I'll squash them and open a new PR that could be reviewed merged later
Rebased and pushed the branch.
@swill Rebased against the current master and also squashed the commits into one.
@rhtyd There are no conflicts here so I don't understand what will be achieve by rebase?
rebased with apache/4.7

rebased with rebased with apache/master.
Add one more commit:  
[VM-SNAPSHOT] add role permissions for new API command createSnapshotFromVMSnapshot

closed as I have more commits for restart network, restartvpc, update network, upgrade network (from old version 4.5 or before).
the downtime of network is reduced to 1-5 seconds.

I am not against it, but we have more KVM Pull Requests open like #1545

At what point do we ask other PRs to be rebased after this one merges in?

LGTM

Very simple Docker fix
I will rebase again, if we do want this.
@swill rebased and pushed. It does have two LGTMs and tests by real people (plus it's in production at here at iWeb) if that makes it a little easier to overrule Jenkins.
@milamberspace Added the localisation key in message.properties and now using it in consoleKeyboardOptions
@swill @rhtyd Updated the PR against the latest master. It was conflicting in imports. Who is going to test this? AFAIK I am the only guy working in Hyper-V.

@nvazquez I am not too familiar with the VMware specific code, rest of the code looks ok.

Also a comment on #1361 when this feature was initially added. NFS version is stored in image_store_details table and needs to be manually added using some sql script. A better way would be to use ConfigKey to expose the configuration. There will be some work involved to include image store as a scope for specifying configuration. May be you can fix it in subsequent PR.
@anshul1886 @anshulgangwar Can you review this?
